__e: When my father died, he left me two things:
My grandfather -- he left me this message on my machine the day he died, and he said that he had found something that the Thule were willing to kill him for.
Now he's dead. And what did he leave me? Squat!
He left a note: "I'm quitting it all.
She left a note saying she went off somewhere with that band of hers, that they went on some road tour.
She left a note saying she was going to see a friend and hasn't been seen since.
If she left a note, the police wouldn't even have looked for her.
I left a note saying I was going to find a family of my own, but I didn't tell her where.
A woman called and left a message, but she was too afraid to leave her name.
- You know, 14 years ago, a woman left behind A baby girl with no one to take care of her.
I left a note saying I was going to find a family of my own, but I didn't tell her where.
I don't know what made me the way I am, but whatever it was left a hollow place inside.
George left it in my car the last time I was at the club.
She left a voicemail asking me to call her, but I hadn't had a chance yet.
Mother left me some money, much more than I thought.
But, uh, she left little notes under our pillows about how much she loved us and how this was the best for everyone and crap like that.
I know... the guy, he leaves a sign.
He's left a big void, I'll tell you that.
